post.summary: Get Detailed Profile API retrieves the latest and most updated data by passign the D&B DUNS number
post.description: Get Detailed Profile API is called when using the Get Company Details button on the UI. It is a real time API used to enrich the account data with most recent and updated information from D&B. It takes the DUNS number as the input and fetches the complete account profile from D&B.

parameters.name: environmentUrl
parameters.description: Test to checkThe environment details of the tenant for which the  organization match is required.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the organization match is required.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The access token in the Bearer: <> format. This parameter is required if you do not specify Reltio-User and Reltio-Password.

parameters.name: Reltio-User
parameters.description: The Reltio login username that must be used. You must specify this if the access token is not specified for authorization.

parameters.name: Reltio-Password
parameters.description: The Reltio login password that must be used. You must specify this if the access token is not specified for authorization.

parameters.name: DnB-Token
parameters.description: The D&B token in the Bearer: format. This parameter is required if you do not specify DnB-User and DnB-Password.

parameters.name: DnB-User
parameters.description: The D&B account username or Consumer Key in Direct+. You must specify this if the access token is not specified for authorization.

parameters.name: DnB-Password
parameters.description: The D&B account password or Consumer Secret in Direct+. You must specify this if the access token is not specified for authorization.

parameters.name: entityURI
parameters.description: Entity URI's in the entities/XXXX format.

parameters.name: plus
parameters.description: This can be set to true or false. If set to true, then the Direct+ based Get Org Match call or Direct+ based Get Detailed Profile is started. Note: You must have a token or an account with the privileges for Direct+ API usage. Otherwise, an authentication error is raised.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: This can be set to cmpelf or cmpelk. The default value is cmpelf. Note: Your account must have access to required product. If you set an arbitrary value for this parameter, the following DnB error appears: Supplied product or version of the product does not exist.

post.summary: Get Upward Account Hierarchy API provides a hierarchical defined structure to complete the organization hierarchy to its global ultimate account
post.description: The Get Upward Account Hierarchy API allows you to request for all parent organizations (all organizations from the current organization to its global ultimate) for a current organization. The API takes the DUNS number of the organization for which all the parent organizations are requested

post.summary: Get Match API returns the D&B DUNS number using the basic account data like name and address
post.description:
The Get Match API is called using the Get Match button on the UI. It is a real time API, that uses the account data like name and address and returns the D&B DUNS number.
The D&B DUNS number is updated in the Reltio account profile. If more than one DUNS numbers are found, multiple account profiles with matching criteria are returned and updated in the associated data tenant. If no match is found, the API returns an error with an appropriate message.

get.summary: Allows you to obtain a tenant's mapping
get.description:
D&B Connector Get mapping API enables you to fetch the mappings for various operations like batch, enrichment etc. performed through D&B Connector.
You can pass the following mappingName as part of the API parameter:
batch, enrichment, filter, match, corporate_linkage

parameters.name: mappingName
parameters.description: The name of the mapping

parameters.name: environmentUrl
parameters.description: The URL of the environment.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The access token in the Bearer format.

get.summary: Returns mapping from the profile by name
get.description:
D&B Connector Get mapping API enables you to fetch the mappings for various operations like batch, enrichment etc. performed through D&B Connector. The profileName is the D&B Connector profile specific for your tenant. You can obtain the profile name using the Get /services/config/tenants API.
You can pass the following mappingName as part of the API parameter:
batch, enrichment, filter, match, corporate_linkage

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Reltio token, in the Bearer {{YourTokenId}} format.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Profile name

parameters.name: mappingName
parameters.description: Mapping name

parameters.name: plus
parameters.description: This parameter can be set to true or false.

post.summary: Update mapping in the profile by name
post.description:
Enables you to update the mappings for various operations like batch, enrichment etc. performed through D&B Connector. The profileName is the D&B Connector profile specific for your tenant. You can obtain the profile name using the Get /services/config/tenants API.
You can pass the following mappingName as part of the API parameter: batch, enrichment, filter, match, corporate_linkage

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Reltio token, in the Bearer {{YourTokenId}} format.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Profile name

parameters.name: mappingName
parameters.description: Mapping name

parameters.name: plus
parameters.description: This parameter can be set to true or false.

parameters.description: Max seconds to wait response files appear on FTP site

parameters.name: minConfidenceCode
parameters.description: DnB returns confidence code for each processed entity in range 1 .. 10. 10 means absolutely confidence.All entities have confidence code less than minConfidenceCode parameter will be marked with error Low Confidence Score. Default value is 7.

parameters.description: Direct+ product name. Default value is cmpelf

parameters.description: S3 bucket to store request and responses raw data files. Note: optional parameter

parameters.name: awsSecretKey

parameters.description: DnB connector provides ability of scheduling batch jobs using standard cron expressions. Note: expression expecting in the UTC time zone. Please convert your local time to UTC before start job

put.description: The Get Match API is called by external service on entity created event and provides an entity JSON body.

post.summary: Start or schedule background process to handle events for the monitoring registration
post.description:
A monitoring background job is a process that lists the event's destination, reads event files and notification files, and uploads them to the corresponding Reltio tenant. The destination, for now, is the S3 bucket only. The monitoring background job can be started manually to immediately process incoming data or can be scheduled using a cron expression.
  • Cron’s scheduled background monitoring process will automatically calculate the new files on each iteration by searching for previously started a job and extract max file timestamp from them which will be used as a starting point for the new job
  • Monitoring background job started without cron expression will treat all existing files in the destination location as new and process them

parameters.name: environmentUrl
parameters.description: The URL of the environment.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant for which the organization match is required.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The access token in the Bearer format.

parameters.name: DnB-User
parameters.description: {{SafeTransport Username}}

parameters.name: DnB-Password
parameters.description: {{SafeTransport Password}}

parameters.name: DnB-Registration
parameters.description: DnB monitoring registration identifier

parameters.name: awsAccessKey
parameters.description: Currently this is not used by PUT process, but is a required attribute. Reserved for future usage. Value: {{AccessKey}}.

parameters.name: awsSecretKey
parameters.description: Currently this is not used by PUT process, but is a required attribute. Reserved for future usage. Value: {{SecretKey}}.

get.summary: Search Entities API searches entities in the data tenant based on the parameters specified in the request.
get.description: The API returns a list of entities from the data tenant that meet the criteria of the specified parameters.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Search query filter for Data Tenant. This enables filtering the entities based on a condition. The format for the filter query parameter is: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*)

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The positive integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response. It can be used to organize pagination in combination with the offset parameter. The default value is 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The positive integer value to identify starting what element in a result set must be returned in a response. It can be used to organize pagination in combination with the limit parameter. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the results based on a property, such as entity type.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Show the results in the ascending or descending order in the response.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect entity's JSON content in the response. Available options:
  • sendHidden: disabled by default, the entity's JSON contains hidden attributes if this option is enabled.
  • ovOnly: return only attribute values that have the ov=true flag.
  • nonOvOnly: return only attribute values that have the ov=false flag. If you have a nested or reference attribute value, where ov=true, but sub-attributes, where ov=false, then these sub-attributes will not appear in the response.
  • searchByOv: Search and sort by all attributes with ov only; disabled by default.

parameters.name: DataTenant
parameters.description: The ID of the Data tenant for which the entities must be searched.

parameters.name: CustomerTenant
parameters.description: The ID of the Customer tenant for which the entities must be searched.

parameters.name: SearchMetadata
parameters.description: Specifies if you want to search metadata along with the entities.

post.summary: Search Entities API searches entities in the data tenant based on the parameters specified in the request.
post.description: The API returns a list of entities from the data tenant that meet the criteria of the specified parameters.

parameters.name: DataTenant

parameters.name: CustomerTenant

parameters.name: SearchMetadata
parameters.description: Specifies if you want to search metadata along with the entities.

post.summary: Import Entity By URI API copies an entity from the data tenant to the customer tenant.
post.description: The endpoint is used to copy an entity from the data tenant to the customer tenant. The entity in the customer tenant is said to be subscribed to the entity in the data tenant. The entity in the customer tenant after the import has the crosswalk with data tenant as the source.

parameters.name: dataEntityUri
parameters.description: URI of the data entity that needs to be imported.

parameters.name: DataTenant
parameters.description: ID of the source Data tenant from which the entity must be imported.

parameters.name: CustomerTenant
parameters.description: ID of the target Customer tenant to which the entity must be imported.

post.summary: Potential Matches Search API searches for entities in the data tenant that may be potential matches for entities in the customer tenant.
post.description:
The API request considers the following settings:
  • The match rules defined in the MANUAL_MATCH section of the Synchronization Configuration are used for search (if the section exists).
  • Entities must not have a label field in their body or these entities will be rejected.

parameters.name: DataTenant
parameters.description: ID of the Data tenant from which the potential matches are required.

parameters.name: CustomerTenant
parameters.description: ID of the Customer tenant for which the potential matches are required.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response.

parameters.name: skipAllImportedEntities
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to true, none of the potential matches from the Data Tenant that are subscribed to by any entity in the customer tenant are displayed. Otherwise, all potential matches from the data tenant, regardless of whether or not each potential match is already subscribed to by an entity in the Customer tenant, are displayed. The default value of this parameter is false.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect entity's JSON content in the response. Available options:
  • sendHidden: disabled by default, the entity's JSON contains hidden attributes if this option is enabled.
  • ovOnly: return only attribute values that have the ov=true flag.
  • nonOvOnly: return only attribute values that have the ov=false flag. If you have a nested or reference attribute value, where ov=true, but sub-attributes, where ov=false, then these sub-attributes will not appear in the response.
  • searchByOv: Search and sort by all attributes with ov only; disabled by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Search query filter for Data Tenant. This enables filtering the entities based on a condition. The format for the filter query parameter is: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*)

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The crosswalks that you want to use for searching entities in the data tenant.

post.summary: Unmerge Entity API removes the subscription of an entity from the data tenant.

post.summary: Import Relation by URI API imports a single relationship by specifying the relationship URI with this API endpoint.
post.description: The endpoint takes the URI of a relationship as a parameter and imports a relationship between the entities into the customer tenant.

parameters.name: dataRelationUri
parameters.description: The Relation URI from the Data tenant which must be imported.

parameters.name: DataTenant
parameters.description: The ID of the source Data tenant from which the relation must be imported.

parameters.name: CustomerTenant
parameters.description: The ID of the target Customer tenant to which the relation must be imported.

example.errorDetailMessage: DataTenant entity can't be imported. The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges
Subscription for DT staticData01 and CT staticCustomer01 does not exist.

innerErrorData.exception: com.reltio.dtss.rest.errors.SubscriptionNotFoundException:Subscription for DT staticData01 and CT staticCustomer01 does not exist.

example.errorMessage: DataTenant relation can't be imported. Too many requests.
example.errorDetailMessage: Max number of retries is exceeded for loadObjects.. com.reltio.dtss.service.api.http.APIClientCriticalException: Max number of retries is exceeded for loadObjects.

example.errorMessage: DataTenant relation can't be imported. quota_exceeded.
example.errorDetailMessage: Code: DATA_ENTITY_CANNOT_BE_IMPORTED_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE; Message parameters: [Max number of retries is exceeded for loadObjects.. com.reltio.dtss.service.api.http.APIClientCriticalException: Max number of retries is exceeded for loadObjects.

post.summary: Import Multiple Relations API imports multiple relations from the data tenant to the customer tenant.
post.description: The endpoint takes a set of relationship URIs as input in the body.

parameters.name: DataTenant
parameters.description: The ID of the Source Data Tenant.

parameters.name: CustomerTenant
parameters.description: The ID of the Target Customer Tenant where the relations must be imported.

example.errorDetailMessage: DataTenant entity can't be imported. The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges
Subscription for DT staticData01 and CT staticCustomer01 does not exist.

innerErrorData.exception: com.reltio.dtss.rest.errors.SubscriptionNotFoundException:Subscription for DT staticData01 and CT staticCustomer01 does not exist.

success.description: The status of the operation. Could be "OK" or "Fail"

message.description: The result of the real-time operation (or error message)

entities.description: The list of affected entity URIs

RealtimeAPIResponse.description: A response class for real-time DnB operations

success.description: The status of the operation. Could be true or false

errors.description: The list of error details of the operation.

successful.description: The status of the operation. Could be true or false

error.description: The error details of the operation.
error.example: Subscription for DT staticData and CT staticCustomer does not exist.

result.description: The successful message of the operation. It can be any type.

message.example: This API has been Deprecated and will be removed in the future.

empty.description: This informs if the result is empty.

OperationStatus.description: A response class for DTSS operations

setAsNotMatch.description: This indicates if the entity is not a match.

alreadySubscribed.description: This indicates if the entity is already subscribed.

relevance.description: The relevance value for the given entities

RuleOperandExplanation.description: The explanation of the match rule operands applied to the entities

ignoreInToken.description: Indicates whether the attribute is included/excluded into match token phrases

AttributeExplanation.description: The outcome of the operand applied to the given entities

useOvOnly.description: If set to true, then only the OV value will be used for matching

matched.description: The final outcome of the match rule applied to the given entities. 'true' if the entities have non-empty match tokens intersection and are equal by the match rule given the attribute values and the operands, otherwise 'false'

matchedByDocuments.description: The outcome of the match rule operands applied to the given entities. 'true' if the entities are equal by the match rule given the attribute values and the operands, otherwise 'false'

matchActionType.description: The type of the match action that should be applied as a result of the match rule. The property is for the match rules of 'relevance_based' type

relevance.description: The relevance value calculated for the given entities. The property is for the match rules of 'relevance_based' type

bypassed.description: The information about the rule bypass status

MatchRuleExplanation.description: The explanation of the match rule applied to the entities

relevance.description: The relevance value for the given entities

MLMatchExplanation.description: The explanation of the Match IQ applied to the entities

foundInMatchTables.description: Some match tokens phrases might not be found in the database tables. In this case the value is 'false'. If all the match token phrases are in the database tables then the value is 'true'

tokens.description: The set of the match token phrases

tokensToBeGenerated.description: The number of tokens that'll be generated by the rule. If this number is greater than maximumTokenExpected, then tokensGenerated will be 0 and tokens will be empty

maximumTokenExpected.description: The maximum number of token that is allowed to be generated for a rule. If tokensToBeGenerated is greater than this, then tokensGenerated will be 0 and tokens will be empty

warning.description: The warning message if tokensToBeGenerated is greater than maximumTokenExpected

first.description: The constraint outcome for the first entity. 'true' means the entity fits the constraint otherwise false

second.description: The constraint outcome for the second entity. 'true' means the entity fits the constraint otherwise false

ignoreInToken.description: Indicates whether the attribute is included/excluded into match token phrases

checkNulls.description: The parameter shows how the result of constraint affects on comparison. Affects only on exactOrNull operand. If parameter is set to false and attribute doesn't fit the condition then comparison doesn't process the attribute as null value. By default set to true

EqualsExplanation.description: The explanation of the constraint operand (equals, notEquals etc)

MatchRuleTokensExplanation.description: The explanation of the generated match token phrases for the given match rule

success.description: The status of the operation. Could be true or false

details.description: The details information of object uploaded.

createdTime.description: The created time of the object.

updatedTime.description: The updated time of the object.

crosswalks.description: The crosswalk information of the object.

success.description: The status of the operation. Could be true or false

slicesByDtUri.description: The detail information of object uploaded by dt uri slices.

succeededDtObjects.description: uri of object which are successfully uploaded in the operation.

success.description: The status of the operation. Could be true or false

perCrosswalk.description: The detail object upload information per crosswalk of the operation.
